MPM.content: we can only write what can be erased—otherwise no promise, no memory
MPM.linkedContent: we can only write what can be erased—otherwise no promise, no memory

MPM.content: [re: de Man, word “deconstruction” inscribing itself instead of being erased] “always already” erases singularity of event, which is erased in its turn before signature of this word [“deconstruction”] > signature asserts itself as history insofar as origin of its “taking-place” is unlocatable
MPM.linkedContent: [re: de Man, word “deconstruction” inscribing itself instead of being erased] “always already” erases singularity of event, which is erased in its turn before signature of this word [“deconstruction”] > signature asserts itself as history insofar as origin of its “taking-place” is unlocatable

A.content: trace borders to mark and at same time erase these lines, which only succeed in erasing themselves (n’arrivent qu’à s’effacer), trace to introduce their impossibility, principle of ruin, their chance, promises the line while compromising it in parasitage, grafting, divisibility
A.linkedContent: trace borders to mark and at same time erase these lines, which only succeed in erasing themselves (n’arrivent qu’à s’effacer), trace to introduce their impossibility, principle of ruin, their chance, promises the line while compromising it in parasitage, grafting, divisibility

S.content: a modality of “avoiding” like using quotation marks or a non-negative crossed-shape crossing out (kreuzweise Durchstreichung); p. 52 the crossing out here symbolizes the fourfold
S.linkedContent: a modality of “avoiding” like using quotation marks or a non-negative crossed-shape crossing out (kreuzweise Durchstreichung); p. 52 the crossing out here symbolizes the fourfold

S.content: re: “Das Wesen der Sprache: Die Sprache des Wesens”—colon erases copula, allows question to be exceeded by pledge (consent to the address, en-gage), “is” would relaunch the question
S.linkedContent: re: “Das Wesen der Sprache: Die Sprache des Wesens”—colon erases copula, allows question to be exceeded by pledge (consent to the address, en-gage), “is” would relaunch the question

FSW.content: traces produce space of their inscription by acceding to period of their erasure, traces constituted by double force of repetition & erasure, of legibility & illegibility
FSW.linkedContent: traces produce space of their inscription by acceding to period of their erasure, traces constituted by double force of repetition & erasure, of legibility & illegibility

FSW.content: unerasable trace, not a trace, full-presence, son of God, sign of parousia, not a seed, not a mortal germ
FSW.linkedContent: unerasable trace, not a trace, full-presence, son of God, sign of parousia, not a seed, not a mortal germ

KH.content: [re: a logic of living memory in Timaeus] effacement (of secondary impressions) would be the figure for the middle (mil-lieu), both for space and time, would not affect originary impression (that of child), ineffaceable once engraved in virgin wax
KH.linkedContent: [re: a logic of living memory in Timaeus] effacement (of secondary impressions) would be the figure for the middle (mil-lieu), both for space and time, would not affect originary impression (that of child), ineffaceable once engraved in virgin wax

BL.content: law becomes something by being a nothing that constantly defers access to itself [tabernacle]; atopology [khōra] erases event, annuls the event, nullification gives birth to the law
BL.linkedContent: law becomes something by being a nothing that constantly defers access to itself [tabernacle]; atopology [khōra] erases event, annuls the event, nullification gives birth to the law

PAS.content: sans remarks same X w/out annulling it, springless spring (ce ressort sans ressort), this re-trait leaves everything intact (sauf, indemne) in appearance [absolute heterogenous neutrality w/out negation], at the same time it has abducted, erased, absolute rapidity of dispossession (dérapage)
PAS.linkedContent: sans remarks same X w/out annulling it, springless spring (ce ressort sans ressort), this re-trait leaves everything intact (sauf, indemne) in appearance [absolute heterogenous neutrality w/out negation], at the same time it has abducted, erased, absolute rapidity of dispossession (dérapage)

PPHS.content: sign erases itself for Hegel, but, unlike for Derrida, preserves signified ideality, through passageway of time
PPHS.linkedContent: sign erases itself for Hegel, but, unlike for Derrida, preserves signified ideality, through passageway of time

SH.content: date es gibt, annulment at work when date inscribes its here and now in iterability, consigns itself to self-forgetfulness, succeeds in effacing itself
SH.linkedContent: date es gibt, annulment at work when date inscribes its here and now in iterability, consigns itself to self-forgetfulness, succeeds in effacing itself

WM.content: white mythology [vis-à-vis Anatole France]: metaphysics, culture of West, erased w/in itself fabulous scene that produced it, this scene remains active—inscribed in white ink; white man takes his own mythology, his own logos, the mythos of his idiom, for universal Reason
WM.linkedContent: white mythology [vis-à-vis Anatole France]: metaphysics, culture of West, erased w/in itself fabulous scene that produced it, this scene remains active—inscribed in white ink; white man takes his own mythology, his own logos, the mythos of his idiom, for universal Reason

WM.content: because metaphoric is plural from the start, it cannot escape syntax, it organizes its division w/in syntax, cannot be what it is except in erasing itself, indefinitely constructing its destruction
WM.linkedContent: because metaphoric is plural from the start, it cannot escape syntax, it organizes its division w/in syntax, cannot be what it is except in erasing itself, indefinitely constructing its destruction

DS.content: double mark, mark erases mark, undecidable stroke > this syntax escapes pertinence of truth, inscribes truth w/in its play [“Mallarmé exemplifies this”—suspect such a claim]
DS.linkedContent: double mark, mark erases mark, undecidable stroke > this syntax escapes pertinence of truth, inscribes truth w/in its play [“Mallarmé exemplifies this”—suspect such a claim]

DS.content: paper & hymen: blankness that allows for fold > forever re-marks itself as disappearance, erasure, non-sense
DS.linkedContent: paper & hymen: blankness that allows for fold > forever re-marks itself as disappearance, erasure, non-sense

OS.content: all anticipation of the meaning of time: onto-theo-teleology; time suppressed the moment one asks the question of its meaning, when one relates it to presence, truth, essence; Hegel: “time is that which erases time” > time, existence of circle, hides from itself its own totality
OS.linkedContent: all anticipation of the meaning of time: onto-theo-teleology; time suppressed the moment one asks the question of its meaning, when one relates it to presence, truth, essence; Hegel: “time is that which erases time” > time, existence of circle, hides from itself its own totality

OS.content: for Hegel, time erases time, Tilgen (to erase) is also an Aufhebung: given that time is pure exterior self, parousia is end of time
OS.linkedContent: for Hegel, time erases time, Tilgen (to erase) is also an Aufhebung: given that time is pure exterior self, parousia is end of time

OS.content: trace is its own erasure, belongs to trace to erase itself, eludes what would maintain it in presence, neither perceptible nor imperceptible
OS.linkedContent: trace is its own erasure, belongs to trace to erase itself, eludes what would maintain it in presence, neither perceptible nor imperceptible

P.content: parergon stands out (se détache), not like work, which also stands out > parergon stands out against 2 grounds (fonds) [work, background], as that which merges (se fond), effaces itself; frame’s thickness as margin not figure—or figure that comes away of its own accord (s’enlève d’elle même)
P.linkedContent: parergon stands out (se détache), not like work, which also stands out > parergon stands out against 2 grounds (fonds) [work, background], as that which merges (se fond), effaces itself; frame’s thickness as margin not figure—or figure that comes away of its own accord (s’enlève d’elle même)

POS.content: writing structurally carries w/in itself (counts-discounts) its own erasure, while marking what remains of this erasure
POS.linkedContent: writing structurally carries w/in itself (counts-discounts) its own erasure, while marking what remains of this erasure

ATIA.content: the question of whether animals can respond also concerns whether they can erase (s’effacer), can they lie, pretend, cover their own tracks
ATIA.linkedContent: the question of whether animals can respond also concerns whether they can erase (s’effacer), can they lie, pretend, cover their own tracks

ATIA.content: that traces can be erased, does not mean someone (man or animal) can erase them
ATIA.linkedContent: that traces can be erased, does not mean someone (man or animal) can erase them

ATIA.content: for Lacan, animals are capable of dansité, sexual lure, hunt, but still just pretense, not a lie [a trace, but not an ability to erase the trace, to pretend to pretend]
ATIA.linkedContent: for Lacan, animals are capable of dansité, sexual lure, hunt, but still just pretense, not a lie [a trace, but not an ability to erase the trace, to pretend to pretend]

ATIA.content: Derrida substituted trace for signifier to ensure that erasure and inscription could be included in the same structure
ATIA.linkedContent: Derrida substituted trace for signifier to ensure that erasure and inscription could be included in the same structure

ATIA.content: no human, no animal, no God has mastery over erasure of trace, nor power to “judge” its erasure
ATIA.linkedContent: no human, no animal, no God has mastery over erasure of trace, nor power to “judge” its erasure

DIF.content: because trace is a simulacrum of presence, erasure belongs to structure of the trace, it has no site > erasures on both sides of trace
DIF.linkedContent: because trace is a simulacrum of presence, erasure belongs to structure of the trace, it has no site > erasures on both sides of trace

DIF.content: inversion of metaphysical concepts: the present becomes trace of trace, sign of sign, mark of erasure > present is a trace & a trace of erasure of trace
DIF.linkedContent: inversion of metaphysical concepts: the present becomes trace of trace, sign of sign, mark of erasure > present is a trace & a trace of erasure of trace

O.content: no speculative dialectic of same and other can master “difference” (economy of mark-erasure, trace) because such dialectic always remains an operation of mastery
O.linkedContent: no speculative dialectic of same and other can master “difference” (economy of mark-erasure, trace) because such dialectic always remains an operation of mastery

RGE.content: Bataille against servile writing (not irresponsible techne of Plato) that serves life, phantom of life, in presence, advocates a trace w/ possibility of effacement absolu > unerasable trace not a trace
RGE.linkedContent: Bataille against servile writing (not irresponsible techne of Plato) that serves life, phantom of life, in presence, advocates a trace w/ possibility of effacement absolu > unerasable trace not a trace

RM.content: Being’s inscription n’arrive qu’à s’effacer, cf. differance/trace
le trait, il arrive à s’effacer dans un autre, reinscribing itself heterologically, allegorically
RM.linkedContent: le trait, il arrive à s’effacer dans un autre, reinscribing itself heterologically, allegorically

TR.content: plus de faute [no more fault, more fault] > vicious circle of excusing & being guilty
TR.linkedContent: plus de faute [no more fault, more fault] > vicious circle of excusing & being guilty

TR.content: guilt as inscription that is ineffaceable, inexorable, inexonerable
TR.linkedContent: guilt as inscription that is ineffaceable, inexorable, inexonerable

TR.content: [re: Confessions] l’oeuvre generates/capitalizes a sort of interest (won’t be so bold as to say surplus value) of guilt: overproduces shame that is archived (not effaced)
TR.linkedContent: [re: Confessions] l’oeuvre generates/capitalizes a sort of interest (won’t be so bold as to say surplus value) of guilt: overproduces shame that is archived (not effaced)

D.content: proliferation, substitution of the unit that adds & effaces itself, counts itself out (se décomptant) at moment of déclenchement; Sollers: “participating in the calculation that effaced us and replaced us”
D.linkedContent: proliferation, substitution of the unit that adds & effaces itself, counts itself out (se décomptant) at moment of déclenchement; Sollers: “participating in the calculation that effaced us and replaced us”

D.content: trace can only imprint itself by referring to another trace (the other), letting itself be upstaged (outrepasser)/forgotten: its force of production stands in relation to energy of its erasure
D.linkedContent: trace can only imprint itself by referring to another trace (the other), letting itself be upstaged (outrepasser)/forgotten: its force of production stands in relation to energy of its erasure

D.content: tracing not simply mere other or outside of erasing: can only trace itself out in in the erasure of its own “presence”
D.linkedContent: tracing not simply mere other or outside of erasing: can only trace itself out in in the erasure of its own “presence”

LI.content: to no longer oppose writing to erasure (accounting for supplementary paradox) is both terrible and yet nonviolent (perhaps nonviolence itself)
LI.linkedContent: to no longer oppose writing to erasure (accounting for supplementary paradox) is both terrible and yet nonviolent (perhaps nonviolence itself)

LI.content: that trace de-limits what it limits is why the finiteness of a context has an indefinite opening—never secure, simple > in this openness of erasure: political responsibility (where irreducible violence communicates w/ an essential nonviolence) > only the irresponsible (to be polemical) will object, those for whom things are always calculable, clear, programmable, decipherable
LI.linkedContent: that trace de-limits what it limits is why the finiteness of a context has an indefinite opening—never secure, simple > in this openness of erasure: political responsibility (where irreducible violence communicates w/ an essential nonviolence) > only the irresponsible (to be polemical) will object, those for whom things are always calculable, clear, programmable, decipherable

ATM.content: for Levinas, to make passage to other, there can’t be an absolute erasure, withdrawal must appear, “He,” only there in seriasure, a series of hiatuses (mouth agape), enlaced erasures
ATM.linkedContent: for Levinas, to make passage to other, there can’t be an absolute erasure, withdrawal must appear, “He,” only there in seriasure, a series of hiatuses (mouth agape), enlaced erasures

OG.content: writing as “signifier of the signifier” no longer means accidental doubling, fallen (déchue) secondarity, but overflows, goes beyond extension of language > comprehends language
OG.linkedContent: writing as “signifier of the signifier” no longer means accidental doubling, fallen (déchue) secondarity, but overflows, goes beyond extension of language > comprehends language

OG.content: signified always already (toujours déjà) functions as signifier: effacing = overflowing
OG.linkedContent: signified always already (toujours déjà) functions as signifier: effacing = overflowing

OG.content: advent of writing, advent of a play which effaces all those abris du hors-jeu (out-of-bounds shelters [transcendental signifieds]) that surveil field of language > destroying the concept sign
OG.linkedContent: advent of writing, advent of a play which effaces all those abris du hors-jeu (out-of-bounds shelters [transcendental signifieds]) that surveil field of language > destroying the concept sign

OG.content: ontotheology, the system functioning as effacing of difference
OG.linkedContent: ontotheology, the system functioning as effacing of difference

OG.content: concept of experience belongs to metaphysics, can only use it [deconstructively] sous rature, “experience” always a relationship w/ presence [cf. Nietzsche’s On the Genea… Preface 1]
OG.linkedContent: concept of experience belongs to metaphysics, can only use it [deconstructively] sous rature, “experience” always a relationship w/ presence [cf. Nietzsche’s On the Genea… Preface 1]

OG.content: transcendental arche must make its necessity felt before letting itself be erased, arche-trace must comply w/ this necessity & erasure (contradictory and not acceptable in logic of identity), it is the disappearance of origin, and also the origin of origin, so to wrench (arracher) trace from classical scheme that would demand it comes after originary nontrace (that would make of it an empirical mark), we must speak of originary trace or arche-trace > but if all begins w/ trace, there’s no originary trace
OG.linkedContent: transcendental arche must make its necessity felt before letting itself be erased, arche-trace must comply w/ this necessity & erasure (contradictory and not acceptable in logic of identity), it is the disappearance of origin, and also the origin of origin, so to wrench (arracher) trace from classical scheme that would demand it comes after originary nontrace (that would make of it an empirical mark), we must speak of originary trace or arche-trace > but if all begins w/ trace, there’s no originary trace

OG.content: a prohibition of proper names is derivative to arche-writing > prohibition only possible because of proper names’ originary erasure, because they belong to a system of differences that condition play of interdict and its transgression [see TACT/ABSTINENCE]
OG.linkedContent: a prohibition of proper names is derivative to arche-writing > prohibition only possible because of proper names’ originary erasure, because they belong to a system of differences that condition play of interdict and its transgression [see TACT/ABSTINENCE]

OG.content: proper name has always been original myth of transparent legibility present under obliteration
OG.linkedContent: proper name has always been original myth of transparent legibility present under obliteration

OG.content: origin/nature as myth of addition, supplementarity annulled by being purely additive > myth of the effacement of the trace
OG.linkedContent: origin/nature as myth of addition, supplementarity annulled by being purely additive > myth of the effacement of the trace

OG.content: for Rousseau, origin as beginning of end, inaugural decadence, separation btwn song & speech: growth of music parallels writing as “dangerous supplement” > gradual forgetting (of voice of nature) usurps, separates, deprives: re-placement as effacement by forgetting
OG.linkedContent: for Rousseau, origin as beginning of end, inaugural decadence, separation btwn song & speech: growth of music parallels writing as “dangerous supplement” > gradual forgetting (of voice of nature) usurps, separates, deprives: re-placement as effacement by forgetting

EU.content: translating structure begins as soon as a reading of “original” text is instituted, offers up language to be read in its very erasure: erased traces of a path (odos), chemin d’effacement, translation passing over/beyond the path of language [beyond Heidegger], passant son chemin
EU.linkedContent: translating structure begins as soon as a reading of “original” text is instituted, offers up language to be read in its very erasure: erased traces of a path (odos), chemin d’effacement, translation passing over/beyond the path of language [beyond Heidegger], passant son chemin

SPEC.content: proper name arrives only to erase itself
complex scene of signature in which inscription arrives only to erase itself
SPEC.linkedContent: complex scene of signature in which inscription arrives only to erase itself

SPEC.content: PP btwn 2 limits of the w/out pleasure: stricture & discharge, preparation & end, desire & final fulfillment: liminary place of passage (hymen indécis pris dans l’anneau), le passage du pas: pleasure arrives only to erase itself
SPEC.linkedContent: PP btwn 2 limits of the w/out pleasure: stricture & discharge, preparation & end, desire & final fulfillment: liminary place of passage (hymen indécis pris dans l’anneau), le passage du pas: pleasure arrives only to erase itself
